author: Buster Hein
title: Big battery could be a huge draw for iPhone 8 upgraders | Cult of Mac
text:
Say goodbye to the home button. Photo: iDropNews 
Morgan Stanley analyst Katy Huberty is predicting big things for iPhone 8 sales once Apple finally unveils the device this fall. 
In her latest research note to clients, the Wall Street analyst predicts that the edge-to-edge OLED display and longer battery life on the iPhone 8 will accelerate upgrades from customers with iPhones that are two years or older. 
Apple will introduce a significant form factor change with wireless charging , Huberty claims in the note obtained by MacRumors . She says other features could also include 3D sensors and advanced AI software upgrades. Upgrading to iPhone 8 
Wall Street is anxious that the new features will trigger more upgrades than ever. As a result, Apple’s stock as hit historic highs this week. While customers in the U.S. are eager for a new iPhone form factor, Huberty says China will love it even more. 
“While we see accelerated upgrades for Apple’s highest end users in all regions, our work suggests China users are especially sensitive to new technology and form factor changes,” says Huberty. 
The iPhone 8 is expected to be announced at an event this fall. Apple may introduce three new sizes with 4.7-inch, 5-inch and 5.7-inch screen sizes.
